column4: It may have, but it's still not usable for the average punter.
Im using Hardy, maybe thats my issue
For instance, I've been transferring an 800mb file to USB for the last 25 minutes
Im almost 3/4 of the way there. People expect USB to just work
But Im not an exception with Windows XP, you see where that is going?
It's better than my stints with Linux 5 years ago, come ahead in leaps and bounds
Im just saying I don't think that ma and pa users are quite ready to swap over
on the contrary...if ma and pa bought a pc in the shop with ubuntu presinstalled they wouldnt care....
its the power users who 'think' they know how their machine works with windows are the ones who will never switch
the windows power user is one who know the steps (clicks) required to get X working but understands nothing of the process involved....windows is for diagram driven intruction manuals
i have set my multimedia system selector to alsa...and i use aoss on progs that seem to hog the soundserver..
for the record i havent removed pulse audio
i merely used 'multimedia system selector' to use alsa instead.
I've never bought a machine with Windows installed on it
